cluster.evacuate.longdesc:
The `cluster.evacuate` provides control over how instances are handled when a cluster member is being
evacuated.

Available Modes:
  - `auto` *(default)*: The system will automatically decide the best evacuation method based on the
     instance's type and configured devices:
    + If any device is not suitable for migration, the instance will not be migrated (only stopped).
    + Live migration will be used only for virtual machines with the `migration.stateful` setting
      enabled and for which all its devices can be migrated as well.
  - `live-migrate`: Instances are live-migrated to another server. This means the instance remains running
     and operational during the migration process, ensuring minimal disruption.
  - `migrate`: In this mode, instances are migrated to another server in the cluster. The migration
     process will not be live, meaning there will be a brief downtime for the instance during the
     migration.
  -  `stop`: Instances are not migrated. Instead, they are stopped on the current server.
  -  `stateful-stop`: Instances are not migrated. Instead, they are stopped on the current server
     but with their runtime state (memory) stored on disk for resuming on restore.
  -  `force-stop`: Instances are not migrated. Instead, they are forcefully stopped.

See {ref}`cluster-evacuate` for more information.
cluster.evacuate.shortdesc: What to do when evacuating the instance

Specify the interval in hours.
To disable looking for updates to cached images, set this option to `0`.
images.auto_update_interval.shortdesc: Interval at which to look for updates to cached images

images.compression_algorithm.shortdesc: Compression algorithm to use for new images in the project

images.default_architecture.shortdesc: Default architecture to use in a mixed-architecture cluster

images.remote_cache_expiry.longdesc: Specify the number of days after which the unused cached image expires.
images.remote_cache_expiry.shortdesc: When an unused cached remote image is flushed in the project

acme.agree_tos.shortdesc: Agree to ACME terms of service

acme.ca_url.shortdesc: URL to the directory resource of the ACME service

acme.domain.shortdesc: Domain for which the certificate is issued

acme.email.shortdesc: Email address used for the account registration

cluster.healing_threshold.longdesc:
Specify the number of seconds after which an offline cluster member is to be evacuated.
To disable evacuating offline members, set this option to `0`.
cluster.healing_threshold.shortdesc: Threshold when to evacuate an offline cluster member

cluster.https_address.shortdesc: Address to use for clustering traffic

cluster.images_minimal_replica.longdesc:
Specify the minimal number of cluster members that keep a copy of a particular image.
Set this option to `1` for no replication, or to `-1` to replicate images on all members.
cluster.images_minimal_replica.shortdesc: Number of cluster members that replicate an image

cluster.join_token_expiry.shortdesc: Time after which a cluster join token expires

cluster.max_standby.longdesc:
Specify the maximum number of cluster members that are assigned the database stand-by role.
This must be a number between `0` and `5`.

cluster.max_voters.longdesc:
Specify the maximum number of cluster members that are assigned the database voter role.
This must be an odd number >= `3`.

cluster.offline_threshold.longdesc: Specify the number of seconds after which an unresponsive member is considered offline.
cluster.offline_threshold.shortdesc: Threshold when an unresponsive member is considered offline

core.bgp_address.shortdesc: Address to bind the BGP server to

core.bgp_asn.shortdesc: BGP Autonomous System Number for the local server

core.bgp_routerid.longdesc: The identifier must be formatted as an IPv4 address.
core.bgp_routerid.shortdesc: A unique identifier for the BGP server

core.debug_address.shortdesc: Address to bind the `pprof` debug server to (HTTP)

core.dns_address.shortdesc: Address to bind the authoritative DNS server to

core.https_address.shortdesc: Address to bind for the remote API (HTTPS)

core.https_allowed_credentials.longdesc: If enabled, the `Access-Control-Allow-Credentials` HTTP header value is set to `true`.

core.https_trusted_proxy.longdesc: Specify a comma-separated list of IP addresses of trusted servers that provide the client's address through the proxy connection header.
core.https_trusted_proxy.shortdesc: Trusted servers to provide the client's address

core.metrics_address.shortdesc: Address to bind the metrics server to (HTTPS)

core.metrics_authentication.shortdesc: Whether to enforce authentication on the metrics endpoint

core.proxy_http.longdesc: If this option is not specified, the daemon falls back to the `HTTP_PROXY` environment variable (if set).

core.proxy_https.longdesc: If this option is not specified, the daemon falls back to the `HTTPS_PROXY` environment variable (if set).

core.proxy_ignore_hosts.longdesc:
Specify this option in a similar format to `NO_PROXY` (for example, `1.2.3.4,1.2.3.5`)

If this option is not specified, the daemon falls back to the `NO_PROXY` environment variable (if set).
core.proxy_ignore_hosts.shortdesc: Hosts that don't need the proxy

core.remote_token_expiry.shortdesc: Time after which a remote add token expires

core.shutdown_timeout.longdesc: Specify the number of minutes to wait for running operations to complete before the daemon shuts down.
core.shutdown_timeout.shortdesc: How long to wait before shutdown

core.storage_buckets_address.shortdesc: Address to bind the storage object server to (HTTPS)

core.syslog_socket.longdesc: Set this option to `true` to enable the syslog unixgram socket to receive log messages from external processes.
core.syslog_socket.shortdesc: Whether to enable the syslog unixgram socket listener

core.trust_ca_certificates.shortdesc: Whether to automatically trust clients signed by the CA

loki.api.ca_cert.shortdesc: CA certificate for the Loki server

loki.api.url.longdesc: Specify the protocol, name or IP and port. For example `https://loki.example.com:3100`. Incus will automatically add the `/loki/api/v1/push` suffix so there's no need to add it here.

loki.labels.shortdesc: Labels for a Loki log entry

loki.loglevel.shortdesc: Minimum log level to send to the Loki server

loki.types.longdesc:
Specify a comma-separated list of events to send to the Loki server.
The events can be any combination of `lifecycle`, `logging`, and `network-acl`.
loki.types.shortdesc: Events to send to the Loki server

backups.compression_algorithm.shortdesc: Compression algorithm to use for backups

instances.nic.host_name.longdesc:
Possible values are `random` and `mac`.

If set to `random`, use the random host interface name as the host name.
If set to `mac`, generate a host name in the form `inc<mac_address>` (MAC without leading two digits).
instances.nic.host_name.shortdesc: How to set the host name for a NIC

instances.placement.scriptlet.longdesc:
When using custom automatic instance placement logic, this option stores the scriptlet.

instances.placement.scriptlet.shortdesc: Instance placement scriptlet for automatic instance placement

network.ovn.integration_bridge.shortdesc: OVS integration bridge to use for OVN networks
